intro: Psychotria glandulicalyx var. bracteifera, commonly known as the Bracteate Psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It is often found in humid, lowland forests and is known for its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties.
